info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CLAY COUNTY THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glen, or 10 miles west of Clay, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clay, Big Otter, Wallback, Glen, Harrison, Nebo, Ivydale, Procious, Servia, and Chloe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
